intro: Bidens hyperborea var. svensonii, commonly known as the alpine ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. This variant is notable for its hardiness and ability to survive in harsh, high-altitude climates.
